description: Smallest integer >= 2 that is not the sum of 2 positive integers whose prime factors are all <= p(n), the n-th prime.
comments: Here we are taking 1 to be the zeroth prime.a(30) > 2570169839. - Donovan Johnson
example: a(1): 2=1+1, 3=1+2, 4=2+2, 5=1+4, 6=2+4, but 7 cannot be written as the sum of two positive integers whose prime factors are all <= 2, so a(1) = 7. a(2): 7=3+4, 8=4+4, 9=1+8, ..., 22=4+18, but 23 cannot be so written, so a(2) = 23.
crossrefs: So far it agrees with A045535. Is this a coincidence or a theorem?
author: Richard Schroeppel , Jun 27 2001
